thread.title: Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees?
thread.title_full: Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees?

title: Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees?
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees? With less than a month to go until Election Day, the amount of independent spending totals nearly $295,000 and will likely continue to climb ahead of November. Post to Facebook Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees? With less than a month to go until Election Day, the amount of independent spending totals nearly $295,000 and will likely continue to climb ahead of November.  //www.king5.com/story/news/politics/city/2015/10/06/whos-behind-the-new-ie-commitees-citizens-alliance-for-limited-growth--progressive-seattle/73462716/   Join the Conversation To   Who's behind the new independent expenditure committees? Natalie Brand, KING 5 Political Reporter 12:05 p.m. PDT October 6, 2015 Bundles of $100 bills 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
SEATTLE -- With less than a month to go until Election Day, the amount of independent spending for Seattle City Council candidates totals nearly $295,000 and will likely continue to climb ahead of November. 
Track how IE money has been spent, as reported by the Seattle Ethics and Elections Commission. 
Two new independent expenditure committees registered last week: Citizens Alliance for Limited Growth and Progressive Seattle PAC. 
Citizens Alliance for Limited Growth backed by John Fox and the "Seattle Displacement Coalition" lists $4,500 in contributions so far. 
Fox has been a vocal opponent of the Mayor Ed Murray's HALA recommendations regarding upzoning, worried about what he calls "runaway growth" in the city. 
Update on HALA recommendations now before City Council 
When asked how the IE money will be used, Fox told KING 5 he's still raising funds and working to determine how the money will be spent. 
"We will never be able to match or come anywhere near the tens of thousands that developers and downtown businesses interests have already poured and continue to pour into some council races and their handpicked candidates. But we felt we must do something on our own to fight back," Fox said over email. 
Meanwhile, the union backed Progressive Seattle PAC was formed in support of candidates Seattle City Council candidates Kshama Sawant (District 3) and Lisa Herbold (District 1). It list contributions of $3,000, so far, from Teamsters Local 117 and the Electrical Workers PAC. 
Campaign watchers expect IE spending to ramp up in the next couple of weeks. 
Unlike, individual donations to a candidate, independent expenditures don't have limits but cannot be made in connection with an individual candidate or the candidate's campaign. So candidates are not supposed to know how that money is being used to help their campaigns. 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read  //www.king5.com/story/news/politics/city/2015/10/06/whos-behind-the-new-ie-commitees-citizens-alliance-for-limited-growth--progressive-seattle/73462716/ TOP VIDEOS
